title: Interpret confidence level for mean lunch money

content.prompt: Based on a random sample of 50 students, the 90 percent confidence interval for the mean amount of money students spend on lunch at a certain high school is found to be ($3.45, $4.15). Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: 90% of the time, the mean amount of money that all students spend on lunch at this high school will be between $3.45 and $4.15.
90% of all students spend between $3.45 and $4.15 on lunch at this high school.
90% of all random samples of 50 students obtained at this high school would result in a sample mean amount of money students spend on lunch between $3.45 and $4.15.
90% of all random samples of 50 students obtained at this high school would result in a 90% confidence interval that contains the true mean amount of money students spend on lunch.
Approximately 45 of the 50 students in the random sample will spend between $3.45 and $4.15 on lunch at this high school.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
